H0.text: Natural selection is the mechanism by which favorable traits become more common in organisms over the course of generations.

H1.text: Evolution is the mechanism by which favorable traits become more common in organisms over the course of generations.

H2.text: Environmental selection is the mechanism by which favorable traits become more common in organisms over the course of generations.

H3.text: Birth is the mechanism by which favorable traits become more common in organisms over the course of generations.

A4.text: These traits can also become more common within a population if the environment that favours these traits remains fixed.

A5.text: When such mutations result in a higher fitness, natural selection favours these phenotypes and the novel trait spreads in the population.
